datafield.subfield: Provost and Executive Vice-President for Academic Affairs.
Provost and Executive Vice-President for Academic Affairs (University of Michigan) records,
Arranged into four subgroups: 1. Central files; 2. Staff files; 3. Supplemental files; 4. Publications.

Central administrative unit which functions as chief executive assistant to the president, responsible for appointments and promotions with oversight for schools, colleges, educational units and programs; including budget planning, legislative relations, institutional research, and affirmative action policies.
Correspondence files of vice-presidents, associate and assistant vice-presidents, and other staff members within the vice-president's office.
Horace H. Rackham School of Graduate Studies.
College of Architecture and Urban Planning.
College of Literature, Science, and the Arts.
Institute for the Study of Mental Retardation and Related Disabilities.
Provost's Task Force on the Campus Climate for Transgender, Bisexual, Lesbian, and Gay Faculty, Staff, and Students
School of Information and Library Studies.
University Center for Adult Education (Wayne State University-University of Michigan-Eastern Michigan University)
Provost and Executive Vice-President for Academic Affairs.
